content:
PersonalizationDictionary Class

In this Article

Encapsulates basic validation rules that indicate whether a piece of custom data is considered personalizable in either PersonalizationScope or PersonalizationScope scope.

Syntax

Declaration

public class PersonalizationDictionary : System.Collections.IDictionary

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • PersonalizationDictionary

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

A PersonalizationDictionary instance is a collection of PersonalizationEntry objects, which consist of a personalization scope and an object value. These entries are assigned a key in the PersonalizationDictionary object.

A good practice is to add all properties to the dictionary using the Save method, regardless of the scope of the page. The .NET Framework saves the information in the appropriate way; for example, shared data is saved when the page is in PersonalizationScope scope. However, shared properties are not saved when a Web Parts value is being saved, the page is in PersonalizationScope scope, and the WebPart control was added with the page in PersonalizationScope scope.

Constructors summary

PersonalizationDictionary()

Initializes a new instance of the PersonalizationDictionary class.
PersonalizationDictionary(Int32)

Initializes a new instance of the PersonalizationDictionary class using the provided parameter.

Properties summary

Count

Gets the number of entries in the dictionary.
IsFixedSize

Gets whether the personalization dictionary is of a fixed size.
IsReadOnly

Gets whether the personalization dictionary is read-only.
IsSynchronized

Gets whether the personalization dictionary is synchronized.
Item(String)

Gets or sets an entry in the personalization dictionary.
Keys

Gets a reference to an ICollection object containing the keys for the personalization dictionary.
SyncRoot

Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the personalization dictionary.
Values

Gets a reference to an ICollection object containing the values in the personalization dictionary.

Methods summary

Add(String,PersonalizationEntry)

Adds personalization entries to the personalization dictionary.
Clear()

Removes all custom state information from the current PersonalizationDictionary object.
Contains(String)

Returns a value indicating whether a piece of custom state information with the same key is contained in the personalization dictionary.
CopyTo(DictionaryEntry[],Int32)

Copies the personalization dictionary state entries as DictionaryEntry instances into the specified array.
GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the entries in the personalization dictionary.
Remove(String)

Removes a custom state entry based on the provided key.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

ICollection.CopyTo(Array,Int32)

Implements the stem.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo* method for the PersonalizationDictionary class.
IDictionary.Add(Object,Object)

Implements the stem.Collections.IDictionary.Add* method for the PersonalizationDictionary class.
IDictionary.Contains(Object)

Implements the stem.Collections.IDictionary.Contains* method for the PersonalizationDictionary class.
IDictionary.Item(Object)

Gets or sets the stem.Collections.IDictionary.Item* property value for the PersonalizationDictionary class.
IDictionary.Remove(Object)

Implements the stem.Collections.IDictionary.Remove* method for the PersonalizationDictionary class.
IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

Implements the stem.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator* method for the PersonalizationDictionary class.

Constructors

  • PersonalizationDictionary()

    Initializes a new instance of the PersonalizationDictionary class.

    public PersonalizationDictionary ();

    Remarks

    This constructor initializes an empty dictionary. The dictionary will treat key values as case-insensitive.

  • PersonalizationDictionary(Int32)

    Initializes a new instance of the PersonalizationDictionary class using the provided parameter.

    public PersonalizationDictionary (int initialSize);

    Parameters

    • initialSize
      Int32

      The estimated number of entries to be stored in the dictionary.

    Remarks

    This constructor initializes an empty dictionary based on the estimated number of entries to be stored in the dictionary. The dictionary will treat key values as case-insensitive.

Properties

  • Count

    Gets the number of entries in the dictionary.

    public virtual int Count { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The number of entries in the dictionary.

    Remarks

    Use this property to get the number of entries in the personalization dictionary.

  • IsFixedSize

    Gets whether the personalization dictionary is of a fixed size.

    public virtual bool IsFixedSize { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      false in all cases.

    Remarks

    This property always returns false because personalization dictionaries are not of a fixed size.

  • IsReadOnly

    Gets whether the personalization dictionary is read-only.

    public virtual bool IsReadOnly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      false in all cases.

    Remarks

    This property always returns false because personalization dictionaries are not read-only.

  • IsSynchronized

    Gets whether the personalization dictionary is synchronized.

    public virtual bool IsSynchronized { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      false in all cases.

    Remarks

    This property always returns false because personalization dictionaries are not synchronized.

  • Item(String)

    Gets or sets an entry in the personalization dictionary.

    public virtual System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry this[string key] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • key
      String

      The key of the entry to be retrieved or changed.

    Property Value

    • PersonalizationEntry

      A PersonalizationEntry representing custom personalization information identified by the key parameter.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      key is null.

    • ArgumentException

      key is either an empty string (""), or trimming key results in an empty string.

    Remarks

    This property works with a PersonalizationEntry object representing custom personalization information that is identified by the key parameter. If there is no value for key, null is returned.

    If key does not already exist, then key (and its associated value) are added to the dictionary.

    Note that you can add a null value to the dictionary, and the indexer can also be used to update the personalization value.

  • Keys

    Gets a reference to an ICollection object containing the keys for the personalization dictionary.

    public virtual System.Collections.ICollection Keys { get; }

    Property Value

    • ICollection

      An ICollection containing the keys for the personalization dictionary.

    Remarks

    Use this method to obtain the keys for a personalization dictionary.

  • SyncRoot

    Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the personalization dictionary.

    public virtual object SyncRoot { get; }

    Property Value

    • System.Object

      An object that can be used to synchronize access to the personalization dictionary.

    Remarks

    For collections whose underlying store is not publicly available, the expected implementation is to return the current instance. Note that the pointer to the current instance might not be sufficient for collections that wrap other collections; those should return the underlying collection's SyncRoot property.

  • Values

    Gets a reference to an ICollection object containing the values in the personalization dictionary.

    public virtual System.Collections.ICollection Values { get; }

    Property Value

    • ICollection

      An ICollection containing the values for the personalization dictionary.

    Remarks

    Use this method to obtain the values from a personalization dictionary.

Methods

  • Add(String,PersonalizationEntry)

    Adds personalization entries to the personalization dictionary.

    public virtual void Add (string key, System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry value);

    Parameters

    • key
      String

      The unique identifier for a piece of state information.

    • value
      PersonalizationEntry

      A piece of state information to be added to the personalization dictionary. This value can be null.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      key is a duplicate of a key already in the dictionary.

      - or -

      key is either an empty string ("") or trimming key results in an empty string.

      - or -

      value is not a PersonalizationEntry.

    • ArgumentNullException

      key is null.

      - or -

      value is null.

    Remarks

    You can call this method, place various pieces of custom state information into the state object, and specify the scope associated with the state value. When a WebPartManager control is in PersonalizationScope scope, you can add name and state information that is associated with either PersonalizationScope scope or PersonalizationScope scope. In PersonalizationScope scope, you can add name and state information associated only with PersonalizationScope scope.

    It is a good practice, however, to add all properties to the dictionary using Save including properties with PersonalizationScope or PersonalizationScope scope, regardless of the scope of the page.

    The .NET Framework only saves the properties with PersonalizationScope scope when appropriate. In other words, shared properties are not saved when a WebPart control that was initially added in PersonalizationScope scope is later saved while the page is in PersonalizationScope scope. In an opposite scenario, if a WebPart control was added to the page in PersonalizationScope scope, and the control is later saved while the page is in PersonalizationScope scope, custom shared property values are saved (along with custom user-scoped properties). For details on personalization data and how shared and user-scoped properties are affected by the personalization scope of the page, see the Web Parts Personalization Overview topic.

    As with any collection, this method increments the collection count by one and any enumerators currently active on the collection should be invalidated.

  • Clear()

    Removes all custom state information from the current PersonalizationDictionary object.

    public virtual void Clear ();

    Remarks

    This method clears all custom state information from the current PersonalizationDictionary object. Any enumerators currently active against the collection should be invalidated. To remove only a specific personalization entry in a personalization dictionary, use the Remove method.

    Note that calling this method on an empty personalization dictionary does not raise an error.

  • Contains(String)

    Returns a value indicating whether a piece of custom state information with the same key is contained in the personalization dictionary.

    public virtual bool Contains (string key);

    Parameters

    • key
      String

      A key value.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the provided key matches a key in the personalization dictionary; otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      key is either an empty string (""), or trimming key results in an empty string.

    • ArgumentNullException

      key is null.

    Remarks

    Use this method to determine whether a piece of custom state information is contained in a personalization dictionary.

  • CopyTo(DictionaryEntry[],Int32)

    Copies the personalization dictionary state entries as DictionaryEntry instances into the specified array.

    public virtual void CopyTo (System.Collections.DictionaryEntry[] array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      DictionaryEntry[]

      The array the DictionaryEntry instances are copied into.

    • index
      Int32

      The index location at which to begin copying.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      array is multidimensional.

      - or -

      array is the wrong size based on the index parameter.

      - or -

      array has insufficient capacity to hold the values contained in the personalization dictionary.

    • ArgumentNullException

      array is null.

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is less than zero.

    Remarks

    Use this method to create an array of DictionaryEntry instances from the state entries in the personalization dictionary.

  • GetEnumerator()

    Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the entries in the personalization dictionary.

    public virtual System.Collections.IDictionaryEnumerator GetEnumerator ();

    Returns

    • IDictionaryEnumerator

      An IDictionaryEnumerator for the personalization dictionary.

    Remarks

    Enumerators can be used to read the data in a collection, but cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. For more information on enumerators, see the IEnumerator interface.

  • Remove(String)

    Removes a custom state entry based on the provided key.

    public virtual void Remove (string key);

    Parameters

    • key
      String

      The key of the entry to be removed.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      key is null.

    • ArgumentException

      key is either an empty string (""), or trimming key results in an empty string.

    Remarks

    Internally, when you remove a custom state entry, the count of the personalization dictionary is decremented by one. Any enumerators currently active against the dictionary should be invalidated.

    No error occurs if you attempt to remove a nonexistent key.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • ICollection.CopyTo(Array,Int32)

    Implements the stem.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo* method for the PersonalizationDictionary class.

    void ICollection.CopyTo (Array array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      Array

      An Array of DictionaryEntry items to copy into a PersonalizationDictionary.

    • index
      Int32

      The starting point in a PersonalizationDictionary at which to insert array.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      array is not an array of DictionaryEntry items.

    Remarks

    The CopyTo method checks to determine whether array is an array of DictionaryEntry items, then calls the PersonalizationDictionary class's own CopyTo method, passing to it array and index.

  • IDictionary.Add(Object,Object)

    Implements the stem.Collections.IDictionary.Add* method for the PersonalizationDictionary class.

    void IDictionary.Add (object key, object value);

    Parameters

    • key
      System.Object

      The String to use as the key for an item in the personalization dictionary.

    • value
      System.Object

      The PersonalizationEntry to add to the personalization dictionary.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      value is null.

    • ArgumentException

      key is not a String object.

      - or -

      value is not a PersonalizationEntry object.

    Remarks

    The Add method checks several details to ensure the validity of value and key before attempting to add them to the personalization dictionary. If the checks are successful, the method calls the PersonalizationDictionary class's own Add method, passing to it the key and value parameters.

  • IDictionary.Contains(Object)

    Implements the stem.Collections.IDictionary.Contains* method for the PersonalizationDictionary class.

    bool IDictionary.Contains (object key);

    Parameters

    • key
      System.Object

      A String object that identifies a particular PersonalizationEntry to check for existence in the personalization dictionary.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if key exists in the personalization dictionary; otherwise false.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      key is not a String.

    Remarks

    The Contains method checks key to ensure it is a valid object for checking the personalization dictionary, and if so, it passes it to the PersonalizationDictionary class's own Contains method.

  • IDictionary.Item(Object)

    Gets or sets the stem.Collections.IDictionary.Item* property value for the PersonalizationDictionary class.

    object System.Collections.IDictionary.Item[object key] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • key
      System.Object

      A String that identifies a particular PersonalizationEntry object in the personalization dictionary.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      A PersonalizationEntry object whose value matches key.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      key is not a String object.

    Remarks

    The Item first ensures that key is a String object, and if so, it calls the PersonalizationDictionary class's own Item property to return the PersonalizationEntry whose key equals key in the current dictionary.

  • IDictionary.Remove(Object)

    Implements the stem.Collections.IDictionary.Remove* method for the PersonalizationDictionary class.

    void IDictionary.Remove (object key);

    Parameters

    • key
      System.Object

      A String that identifies a particular PersonalizationEntry object to remove from the personalization dictionary.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      key is not a String.

    Remarks

    The Remove method checks whether key is a String object, and if so, it calls the PersonalizationDictionary class's own Remove method, passing key to it.

  • IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

    Implements the stem.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator* method for the PersonalizationDictionary class.

    System.Collections.IEnumerator IEnumerable.GetEnumerator ();

    Returns

    • IEnumerator

      An instance of IEnumerator to enumerate through the items in a personalization dictionary.

    Remarks

    The GetEnumerator method directly calls the PersonalizationDictionary class's own GetEnumerator method.
